subject: Cybersecurity
title: Operation Onymous: The Dark Web's Worst Day
description: A quick, practical guide to Operation Onymous: The Dark Web's Worst Day.

hook.text: In a single day, 17 countries coordinated to seize over 400 dark web sites and arrest dozens of operators.

buildup.text: Operation Onymous in 2014 was led by Europol and the FBI. It targeted dark web markets, forums, and services.

discovery.text: The operation seized millions in Bitcoin and shut down markets including Silk Road 2.0.

twist.text: How they found the hidden servers was never fully explained. The secrecy left dark web users paranoid â€“ which was.

climax.text: Onymous showed that international cooperation can penetrate the dark web. The anonymity isn't as strong as believed.

punchline.text: 400 sites seized in one day. The dark web held its breath.

quiz.question: What made Operation Onymous significant?
options: It was the first cyber investigation
17 countries coordinated to seize 400+ dark web sites in a single day
